comment: This has to be the worst possible professor I have have had. Very poorly organized. He may be very focused on his research, but does not appear to have any practical experience in developing commercial games. We could not understand why he is teaching subjects that he clearly has no practical experience in doing.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: This is one of the best professors I have ever had at KSU. If you study you will be fine and If you don't you will still pass his class.

Rongkai is AWESOME! Do not listen to these negative reviews! Very easy going, funny, and very passionate. Rongkai is really inspirational and has a big heart, also the material IS NOT HARD! Three projects (got 100% on each even after forgetting to include some files), a final project, and a final test. Test is on powerpoints. Take HIM! A++

One of the worst professors at Kennesaw. He's a nightmare to present for since he has a strict criteria for progress and embarrasses the people presenting by telling them they did no work that week. His mood while presenting seemed really unprofessional. He also has limited knowledge on games /game design. Most of his work revolves around VR.
Rongkai is a great professor. He cares about his students and knows what he's talking about.

He seemed a bit uninspired throughout the course and it didn't sit well with students. He just wanted more from the class but when people are taking 3 or so other high level courses, its a bit much to ask. Still he is a fair grader, good personality and well worth taking if you get the chance.

Rongkai is an amazing teacher. I was ill prepared for his class (I was in my first semester of programming) and he was still very supportive and was always there for me when I needed help. He explains everything very well and is, in my opinion, more than fair with grading. DEFINITELY take him if you can!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Teacher. Had for 3D Modeling and learned all the things.
He's a smart professor who knows what he's talking about. However, be careful with projects and grades because he DOES NOT round. I had a C at a 78.9.. I would have gotten a B if he had rounded...

he is a nice guy, tried really hard to make this work. But he has very limited knowledge in making games. His ancient is hard to understand. Don't expect to much from him. Makes promises that he does not deliver on. I think he might be here for another reason than teaching.

This class was strange in that there were barely any grades. We just had one homework assignment, two projects, and the final. The final was easy and he gave us more than enough time to work on the projects. His schedule was pretty disorganized and we changed paths a couple of times, but it was mostly a good experience. Don't get any zeroes!

Rongkai's lectures in this class were long and often hard to follow, and his English is rough. However, if you teach yourself the material online you can do the projects and tests quite easily. He's a fair grader and if you disagree with a grade he gives you, he will change it. I got several C's raised to A's by talking with him. He's a nice dude.

I feel like Rongkai tried really hard to make this a good class for us, but unfortunately it didn't come together very well. The course's pacing was all over the place and Rongkai didn't have much experience with the subject (3D modeling). His lectures were pretty bad and his lack of English skills made them worse. I didn't learn much.
